org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards

Class CardDataImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards.PublishableCard
      • org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards.CardDataImage

  • public class CardDataImage
extends PublishableCard
    Class representing an image that should be displayed along with a parent CardData. Any number of CardDataImage objects can be associated with a CardData, and as many as possible will attempt to be displayed with the Card in CM Home. As with CardData, a CardDataImage will be published when PublishableCard.publish(Context) is called. CardDataImage objects can similarly be removed from view by calling PublishableCard.unpublish(android.content.Context).

        public void setInternalId(java.lang.String internalId)

        Parameters:
        internalId - The String to be used to uniquely identify this card.

      • setCardDataId

        public void setCardDataId(long cardDataId)
        Sets the ID of the CardData that this image is associated with. This required field tells CM Home which Card this image will be displayed with.
        Parameters:
        cardDataId - The ID of the Card that this image is a child of, as returned by PublishableCard.getId().

      • getImageUri

        public android.net.Uri getImageUri()
        Retrieves the Uri that resolves to the image that this CardDataImage will display.
        Returns:
        The Uri that resolves to the image this object represents.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(android.net.Uri imageUri)
        Sets the Uri that resolves to the image that this CardDataImage will display.
        Parameters:
        imageUri - A URI to this image (all types, including internet resources, are allowed).

      • setImage

        public void setImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the image bitmap to the given bitmap.

        When PublishableCard.publish(Context) is called on this CardDataImage, this bitmap is saved to a cache within the internal storage for this application, to be accessed only by CM Home through a ContentProvider. If the same Bitmap is passed for any other image, the same cached image will be used.

        Parameters:
        bitmap - The Bitmap to save for this CardDataImage.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(int resource)
        Sets the image to the image that the given resource ID resolves to.

        When PublishableCard.publish(Context) is called on this CardDataImage, this image is saved to a cache within the internal storage for this application, to be accessed only by CM Home through a ContentProvider. If the same Bitmap is passed for any other image, the same cached image will be used.

        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to save for this CardDataImage.

      • setImageLabel

        public void setImageLabel(java.lang.String imageLabel)
        Sets a String that will be used to identify this image. This may be used for a caption or title for this image.
        Parameters:
        imageLabel - A String that identifies this image.

      • getAllPublishedCardDataImages

        public static java.util.List<CardDataImage> getAllPublishedCardDataImages(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves all currently published CardDataImages for this application.
        Parameters:
        context - A Context of the application that published the CardDataImages originally.
        Returns:
        A list of all currently live and published CardDataImages for this application only.

      • createFromCurrentCursorRow

        public static CardDataImage createFromCurrentCursorRow(android.database.Cursor cursor,
                                       java.lang.String authority)
        Creates a new CardDataImage from the data row that the input cursor currently points to. This is intended to be an internal method. Please use one of the helper methods to retrieve CardDataImages.
        Parameters:
        cursor - A Cursor object that currently points to a row with CardDataImage data.
        authority - The authority of the ContentProvider that hosts the ContentProvider being read from.
        Returns:
        A CardDataImage containing the data from the input cursor row.

      • getPublishedCardDataImagesForCardDataId

        public static java.util.List<CardDataImage> getPublishedCardDataImagesForCardDataId(android.content.Context context,
                                                                    long cardDataId)
        Retrieve a list of all currently published CardDataImages that have the CardData given by cardDataId as a parent.
        Parameters:
        context - The A Context of the application that published the CardDataImages originally.
        cardDataId - The ID of the CardData that is the parent of the CardDataImages being queried for.
        Returns:
        A list of CardDataImages that have the given CardData as a parent.
